special_blocks.title: Recording Specications
items: Frame Rate: 24 fps (cinematic standard)
Shutter Speed: 1/48 second (180° shutter rule - natural motion blur)
ISO Range: 160-800 (push in post for night mood; denoise in color grade)
Color Prole: Film Log or Flat 10-bit if available (maximum color grading latitude)
Aspect Ratio: Shoot 16:9 native; add 2.39:1 letterbox in post (black bars
top/bottom)
Focus: Manual throughout (lock before each sequence; use peaking for precision)
White Balance: Lock per scene
Room sequences: 3200K (tungsten, warm)
Street sequences: 2600K (sodium streetlights, amber)
Morning sequences: 3500K (golden hour, transitional)
File Format & Codec
Primary: ProRes 422 HQ (professional quality, editing-friendly)
Backup: H.264 AVC if storage limited (smaller les, re-encodable)
Resolution: 4K (3840x2160) for future-proong; downscale to 1080p in post if
needed
Stabilization Protocol
Tripod shots: OIS OFF (disable on-sensor stabilization to prevent drift)
Handheld/Gimbal shots: OIS ON

special_blocks.title: EP01 TECHNICAL BIBLE (COMPREHENSIVE SPECIFICATIONS)
items: Gimbal specs: 3-axis stabilizer (recommended: DJI RS3 Mini or equivalent)

special_blocks.title: Audio Specication
items: Sample Rate: 48 kHz (broadcast standard)
Bit Depth: 24-bit (professional quality)
Recording Method: Blackmagic Camera app audio input + external mic
Microphone: Lavalier clip-on mic (budget: ₹1000-2000) or EarPods built-in mic

special_blocks.title: Color Grading Reference (Per Scene Type)
items: ROOM SEQUENCES (Interior, Low-Key Mood)
White Balance: 3200K locked
ISO: 200-400 (push to 800 if very dark, denoise post)
Color Grade:
Desaturate overall palette: -15 to -25% saturation reduction
Beige-green cast: +3 green in shadows, -2 blue in highlights
Contrast: Crush blacks slightly (-5 to -10%), preserve highlight detail
Vignette: Light edge vignette (5-10% opacity) for isolation
Grain: Add 10-15% lm grain (1080p noise acceptable; hides compression)
Optional LUT: Kodak Portra 400 (warm lm stock aesthetic)
Lamp glow: Warm highlights (+5 yellow) → isolation aesthetic
JAIPUR NIGHT SEQUENCES (Exterior, High-Contrast Mood)
White Balance: 2600K locked
ISO: 400-800 (night requires higher; denoise in post)
Color Grade:
Warm amber-orange highlights (streetlights): +10 yellow, +5 red in highlights
Deep blue shadows: +8 blue in shadows (120° color wheel opposite to orange)
Lift shadows: Add 20-30% lift to shadow area (reveal alley detail without
losing mystery)
Crush blacks: Crush blacks in street (emphasize contrast; -10 to -15%)
Saturation: +15 to +25% boost neon signs and warm streetlights
Secondary color grading: Use secondary color wheels to:
Push streetlights warmer (orange): +10 hue shift toward orange, +5
saturation
Push shadows cooler (blue): -8 hue shift toward blue, +3 saturation
Grain: Add 20-25% lm grain (night naturally noisier; match aesthetic)
Highlight protection: Knee curve to protect streetlight clipping (preserve
detail in bright lights)
MORNING / SUNRISE SEQUENCES (Exterior, Golden-Hour Mood)
White Balance: 3500K locked
ISO: 160-280 (plenty of light; minimal noise)
Color Grade:
Warm golden tones: +15 yellow, +8 red (capture golden hour vibrancy)
High saturation: +20 to +30% increase saturation (golden hour peak colors)
Lift shadows: Minimal (golden hour naturally well-lit)
Contrast: Slight push in midtone separation (high-contrast morning light)
Grain: Minimal; 5-10% only (morning light naturally clean)
Vignette: Skip or reduce (natural frames, no added isolation)
PARANOIA / MYSTERY SEQUENCES (Overlay on other mood, intensied)
Base color grade: Apply room OR night grade, then layer:
Desaturation: Additional -10 to -15% push toward B&W (psychological
unease)
Green cast: Push color wheel shadows toward green (+5 green overall; sickly
aesthetic)
Vignette: Increase to 15-20% (claustrophobic framing)
Contrast: High contrast push; crush blacks further (-15 to -20%)
Do NOT overdo: Keep grounded; avoid horror-movie cliché (maintain
believability)
